snippet: The two largest American oil companies said their refining businesses more than made up for the recent drop in the price of crude oil.
abstract: Exxon Mobil and Chevron report surprisingly strong quarterly earnings, despite fall in oil prices; Exxon Mobil's quarterly profit rose to $8.07 billion from $7.87 billion in year-ago period; Chevron's quarterly earnings rose to $5.59 billion compared with $4.95 billion year earlier; robust profits are due to refineries, which for years were plodding fifth wheel of their businesses.
lead_paragraph: The two largest American oil companies said their refining businesses more than made up for the recent drop in the price of crude oil.

headline.main: At Exxon Mobil and Chevron, Refining Businesses Support Earnings
headline.print_headline: At Exxon Mobil and Chevron, Refining Businesses Support Earnings
